abstract: Firms like Goldman Sachs and JPMorgan Chase would have to bolster their capital cushion and post additional collateral for certain derivatives trades under the new plan proposed by the Securities and Exchange Commission.
snippet: Firms like Goldman Sachs and JPMorgan Chase would have to bolster their capital cushion and post additional collateral for certain derivatives trades under the new plan proposed by the Securities and Exchange Commission.
lead_paragraph: Federal authorities moved a step closer to overhauling the derivatives market on Wednesday, as regulators proposed tougher standards for the nation’s biggest banks.

headline.main: Regulators Propose Capital Rules for Derivatives Trading

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: Dodd-Frank Wall Street Reform and Consumer Protection Act (2010)
